snippet.textDisplay:
couldnt help commenting here.... the negative comments on the attempts to experiment with the song expose the shallowness of so many of us bengalis. the snootiness of the british have not really left us....you may or may not like the version and you have every right to your POV. but saying that " this song should not be experimented with" is stupid. simply because it goes vehemently against  the very concept of faqiri/baul. baul-faqiri is completely about embracing the world, breaking all kinds of boundaries and immersing in everything that the universe has to offer... in the quest for moner manush. thats why both hindu and muslim... even elements of other religions find a place in the philosophy of the bauls.

believe me. if lalon was alive and he had seen someone trying to do something new with his song then he would have been the happiest.... because locking up something in the name of "culture" is completely opposite to the philosophy of bauls...
snippet.textOriginal:
couldnt help commenting here.... the negative comments on the attempts to experiment with the song expose the shallowness of so many of us bengalis. the snootiness of the british have not really left us....you may or may not like the version and you have every right to your POV. but saying that " this song should not be experimented with" is stupid. simply because it goes vehemently against  the very concept of faqiri/baul. baul-faqiri is completely about embracing the world, breaking all kinds of boundaries and immersing in everything that the universe has to offer... in the quest for moner manush. thats why both hindu and muslim... even elements of other religions find a place in the philosophy of the bauls.

believe me. if lalon was alive and he had seen someone trying to do something new with his song then he would have been the happiest.... because locking up something in the name of "culture" is completely opposite to the philosophy of bauls...
